Package net.keinr.util

Class Tester

java.lang.Object
net.keinr.util.Tester
public class Tester
extends java.lang.Object
A simple class for running multible tests. When adding via `public void add(Test test)` you can use lambda so that's kinda' cool. Do note that it MUST return a boolean. An example of the use of this class would be: int someValue = 6; Tester test = new Tester(); test.add(() -> { if (someValue == 5) { return true; } return false; }); boolean[] results = test.run(); for (int i = 0; i < results.length; i++) { System.out.println("Test "+i+": " + (results[i]?"PASSED":"FAILED")); }
Since:
2019-10-6

    An interface that allows the parameterization of new methods to be run by its parent class
